text: PEOPLE, PLACES AND SPACES the communal amenity space should promote physical activity such as outdoor gyms or gardening, and part should encourage rest and relaxation. 14.69 Parts 1(k) to (p) set out requirements relating to residential amenity. For the purposes of these parts, a habitable room is defined as a room within a dwelling, the primary use of which is for living, sleeping, or dining. This definition includes living rooms, dining rooms, bedrooms, studies, home offices, and conservatories but excludes halls, corridors, bathrooms, and lavatories. Kitchens which provide space for dining and have windows will be considered habitable rooms and should be included in the assessment of amenity impacts.
